intro: Pseudostellaria retusa, commonly known as the slender starwort, is a flowering plant native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes other well-known plants like carnations and poppies. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. Pseudostellaria retusa is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
